original: FRIMAN, Carl Harry, Kapten, Stockholm, f Skövde 14/8 91 av kamrer P E F o Alma Muntzing, gm Märta Skog. Stud i Tyskl 10, 1 Engl 11, ex tekn sk Sthlm 12. Resoffex 15, fänr Vnorrl reg:s res 15, löjtn 18, kapt 30. Ing v A Karlson Metall- & Maskin AB Sthlm 12—16, ch f maskinavd där sed. 16. Styr.led i Falu Mek Verkst AB 17—23. Ordf Tekn frn M S Sthlm 30—32 o 34—36, led Sv Tekn.frn. K m:ts ombud i Sthlms Skyttefrb sed. 34. Resor: Tyskl, Engl, Danm, Norge, Holl, Belg, Schweiz o Ital v öl tillf 10—39. Sthlms Skyt-tefrbs ftJM, Sthlms Lstfrbs ftJM, guldmärken i idrott, skidlöpn, Skytte, pistol (av militära), Arméns skytteM, RiksGM, Mästarmärke g. Hobbies: Arbetet, Skytte, idrott.
translated: FRIMAN, Carl Harry, Captain, Stockholm, born in Skövde on August 14, 1891, the son of treasurer P. E. F. and Alma Muntzing, married to Märta Skog. Studied in Germany for 10 months, in England for 11 months, and graduated from a technical school in Stockholm in 1912. Commissioned officer examination in 1915, second lieutenant in the reserve of the Northern Infantry Regiment in 1915, promoted to lieutenant in 1918, and to captain in 1930. Employed at A. Karlson Metall- & Machine Co. in Stockholm from 1912 to 1916, then became head of the machinery department there since 1916. Board member of Falu Mek Verkst AB from 1917 to 1923. Chairman of the Technical Society of Stockholm from 1930 to 1932 and 1934 to 1936, member of the Swedish Technical Association. Appointed as a representative by the Royal Majesty's delegate in Stockholm's Sharpshooting Association since 1934. Traveled to Germany, England, Denmark, Norway, Holland, Belgium, Switzerland, and Italy multiple times between 1910 and 1939. Achievements: Stockholm's Sharpshooting Association gold medal, Stockholm's Cross Country Skiing gold medal, marksmanship with gun and pistol (from the military), Army Sharpshooter medal, National Golden Cross in Shooting, Master's badge. Hobbies: Work, shooting, sports.
